content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the `wrap_string` function and an example:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            if current_line != ""  # Add a space only if not the first word on line
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        else
            pushfirsttolast(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    
    # Push last line if any
    if current_line != ""
        pushfirsttolast(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(reverse(lines), "\n")
end
```

You can use the `wrap_string` function like this:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
println(wrap_string(text))
```

In this example, we wrap a text string into lines of length 10. The output would be:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit.
```
